messages.content:
Subject: Invitation to be a Guest on "Tech Talks" – Crypto 101 Episode

Dear Dr. Nguyen,

I hope you’re doing well. My name is Jordan Lee, host of the "Tech Talks" podcast, where we explore emerging technologies and demystify complex topics for a broad audience.

We’re planning an upcoming episode titled **"Crypto 101: How to Get Started"**, aimed at listeners who are new to cryptocurrency and want a clear, approachable introduction. Given your acclaimed work as a professor of Economics and author of *Crypto for Everyone*, we believe you would be an ideal guest to help our audience grasp the fundamentals in an engaging and beginner‑friendly way.

In the episode, we’d love for you to:
• Explain what cryptocurrency is and why it matters.
• Break down key concepts like blockchain, wallets, and security in simple terms.
• Share practical advice for newcomers who want to explore crypto safely.

We typically record for about 45 minutes and can accommodate your schedule. We also handle all technical setup and can provide a brief prep sheet ahead of time.

Would you be interested in joining us? I’d be happy to discuss any details and answer any questions you might have.

Thank you for considering our invitation. I look forward to the possibility of featuring your expertise on "Tech Talks".

Warm regards,
Jordan Lee
Host, Tech Talks Podcast
jordan.lee@techtalks.com
Here’s the draft email you can send to Dr. Alice Nguyen. Feel free to edit any details or let me know if you’d like any changes.
That looks great! Send it on my behalf.

I don’t have direct email‑sending capabilities, but you can copy the draft above into your email client and send it to alice.nguyen@berkeley.edu. Let me know if there’s anything else I can help with, such as preparing interview questions or scheduling the recording.
